text:
Amazing thank you. Plan is to automate the deactivation of users as part of the leaver process (10+ HS accounts to remove from).

Of course, this sounds like something for the ideas board in the meantime
thank you

The Batch update HubDB rows API is broken, my code was working and yesterday stopped working, i’ve tried multiple things in postman and it’s still not working
```        "status": "COMPLETE",
        "results": [],
        "numErrors": 1,
        "errors": [{
            "status": "error",
            "category": "INTERNAL_ERROR",
            "message": "Failed to partially update row 121310328358 in batch update. Please retry operation."
        }],
        "startedAt": "2023-07-12T11:52:13.324Z",
        "completedAt": "2023-07-12T11:52:13.335Z"```
The only thing that doesn’t throw an error is if I leave the values blank but obviously that then doesn’t update the row…
it's interesting that a request to the blog posts API doesn't return the name of the blog where the post is in—it just returns the contentGroupId
any chance I'm missing it? I guess I can just map to the named values but feels weird
and requires maintaining the associations...what's the better way of showing blog names inside of blog posts?

I'm trying to query email events using the python client library, but I keep getting an error to the effect of "pass an object type" even though I'm specifying that I'm querying events related to emails. Would anyone be able to help me figure this out? I'm trying to query the endpoint using a key associated with a private app.
Second question: is it possible to generate oauth credentials using a private app key?

Hey! You should use contentGroupId and map with
<https://api.hubapi.com/blogs/v3/blogs>
Don't know any other ways
ok, thanks. A bummer I have to make a new request but better than any of the alternatives
<@U05EJLL49KQ> do v3 versions of the blog API always require authentication?
yep. And which api do not require auth?
I thought the old blog API didn't require auth
but it might not even exist anymore
But it's unsecured. How it can be possible?:thinking_face:
blog posts are public
but I don't think it exists anymore / I don't see a "ready only" way to make requests
yep, but you can hide some blogs or something else
yea, in any case, I appreciate the help!
user provisioning endpoints are fairly new so get those ideas in there!
Hi Teun! My apologies for the delayed response here. I’ll check with the engineering team to see why you’re seeing this error.

After asking the team to do some digging, it appears that the List endpoint does have a limit of 500 associations per request. Thank you for reporting this discrepancy, as the error message was very helpful in troubleshooting the problem! We will make sure to correct the documentation.
The team will be updating the documentation tomorrow afternoon! Thank you for your patience here :slightly_smiling_face:
Hello I need some help here with Webhooks :disappointed: is this the right place to ask?
Approximately next week we'll release a feature where you can GET threads and filter by contactID. I'll let you know when it's live/docs are published!
Yes
Awesome! <@U038DUUV3GE>

I am not a developer, but trying to create an app within HubSpot that contains my api key, I am using it for authentication. I am running a post WHook from HubSpot to another system. Not sure how to set up the app, I have it open but all values are generated already.
Need an app for the auth there in the post webhook

Apps authenticate via oauth 2.0 flows, not api key. You have to build something out to carry out the oauth handshake to get an access key instead of an api key.

I have not actually used webhooks from inside a workflow before so I don’t know if entering the HubSpot app id is mandatory or not or if it’s just used for generating the signature.
gotcha! Thank you <@U038DUUV3GE>
In your HubSpot account go to settings/ integrations / private apps / find your key and choose edit, go to the scopes tab and search for `e-commerce` check the box and commit changes
This might help with getting OAuth setup: <https://academy.HubSpot.com/lessons/using-oauth-with-HubSpot>
Perfect! Thank you for looking into this!
